lexUnit.name: hobble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: walk awkwardly, typically because of pain

sentence.text: This one hobbled about gamely , seemingly eager to get back to the open plains .
Instead of sitting down , Luce skirted an elegant bureau and hobbled across to a large bookcase .
I hobbled behind .
When O'Hara had gone Vernon hobbled upstairs to ring Harcourt .
He left the hospital three months later and spent another six months hobbling about on crutches and having treatment .
For the next few weeks , he hobbles about with them wherever he goes .
The sergeant hobbled along the red carpet in his flip-flops and paused alongside a line of footpaths containing a bright purple solution and cubes of ice .
The old lady hobbled along the line again , pausing almost for half a minute each in front of a besuited man and the slovenly individual with the studded ear .
Mr. Waddicar was hobbling along the corridor .
Except when you are hobbling around dispatching shot after shot into the beautifully manicured lakes thoughtfully scattered around the landscape , leaving a trail of Band-Aids in your wake .
The old woman hobbled around the verandah , consumed with fury and frustration .
At 10 o'clock I hobbled around the kennels while the kennel girl watched Toby .
Swarf looked pleased and hobbled around the courtyard , laughing to himself .
He finally bowed to the inevitable after 61 minutes , when he was visibly hobbling around .
Anthony -- the ` h " is n't silent , you have to lisp it -- from The Chili Peppers was seen hobbling around on crutches today .

The swiftly reacting keeper bravely threw himself at McCarthy 's feet after Mitch Cook was brushed aside by the forward , and caused a measure of concern as he hobbled around after lengthy treatment .
So I hobbled away , my shoulders involuntarily hunched against the thought of eyes behind me , watching .
The big black one mounted a motor cycle and roared off , leaving the old man to hobble away through the estate on his wooden leg .
I am who I am , right now , this minute , and if you ca n't see who that person is -- then to hell with you ! " she renounced and hobbled away to the nearest stool .
` No more'n he deserved , " said Albert heartlessly , and hobbled back to his duties .
As he 'd hobbled back through the sleet a tiny part of him had hoped her gratitude would include an embrace , or at least a few words that would let him know she felt something for him .
Emptied , washed -- now she smelt the same soap on herself with her own feminine tang underneath -- she hobbled back to the island of safe territory that her bed had come to represent .
I hobbled back to the animal , loosened the knot then retied it , pulling till my eyes popped .
The priest also came hobbling in , his long hair swinging like a veil round his emaciated face .
` And when I see him hobbling in at night , I am very proud of him . "
Then his replacement , 34-year-old Cyrille Regis , hobbled off injured after 13 minutes .
` Cherchez la femme , " he said cryptically , and hobbled off chuckling to himself .
The referee hobbled off with a pulled muscle .
Which left her with no alternative but to hobble on as best she could .
He hobbled out the sick bay and disappeared into his workshop , locking the door behind him .
I hobbled out onto the hillside .
I hobbled over to collect the missing shoe and the dress detached itself a press stud at a time , disengaging itself completely as I bent -- bottom to camera -- to retrieve the shoe .
Swarf hobbled over .
Crawling out of bed , doubled over with the pain in his gut he hobbled over to the window and let out a frightened cry .
She hobbled over to him , wincing with pain .
An inner excitement gripped me as I saw in my mind 's eye an image of Clare trying to hobble round her bedroom .
Sometimes he was in such pain , he could hardly hobble up the yard .
` I 'll go to Liverpool , " he whispered as he hobbled up the stairs , ` and I shall outbid all of them . "
Tilda , who knew them all , loved to imitate them , and hobbled up Partisan Street alternately limping and shuffling , with distorted features .
` Let's hope he does n't want you to hobble up the aisle with a leg in plaster . "
` I 'm sorry , " sobbed Jane , hobbling painfully home .
As the room fell suddenly , tensely silent , he began to walk , to hobble painfully and with difficulty towards Sabine .
As she hobbled and hopped in agony Mrs Freer , the Fashion Buyer , fumed .
But Norwich social services bosses say he does not need the pass because he can hobble a quarter of a mile without help .
FOOTBALLER Tom Delaubenque , 23 , was forced to hobble two miles home with a broken leg because an X-ray department was closed .
Gentle began to follow , but the fall had left him aching in every joint , and he knew the chase was lost before he 'd hobbled three yards .
Later , crippled by paralysis , he could only hobble about the streets , before being confined to his room in Brighton .
So I kept up the act , I opened the door and said his name in a quiet voice and hobbled weakly across the cellar and up the steps .
Mr. Waddicar the caretaker was hobbling across the landing , like an old lollipop man frustrating traffic .
It was not until they came out into the clearing where the lame horse was dismally hobbling amongst the forest grasses that he became aware of what had happened .
Their swollen feet had bled profusely and they had hobbled painfully among the rubber trees for more than a month before they recovered .
Dave Crooks , who makes a habit of jumping off such things as Swallow Falls and the Anvil at the Bitches in an open canoe , was hobbling around Crystal Palace on crutches .
She hobbled from the bedroom into the living room .

Currie were not helped by injuries to Darren Clarke and Ian Russell , who hobbled from the field in the second-half , but they were always prepared to run the ball and were enterprising in everything they did .
As soon as he 'd gone she seized the crutch he 'd brought up , and , hobbling into the bathroom , closed the door with a bang .
AMERICAN Civil War fanatic Ray Loveslife-Brown will hobble into his next ` battle " on crutches -- after blowing off a toe with his musket .
The old man hobbled into the circle of light , turning his cloth cap in his hands .
Then with her crutch to aid her she slipped out of the door and round the blind side of the building , hobbling into the cover of the under-brush .

A large man and a small boy appeared at the other end of the platform : she hobbled on her heels , humping her heavy suitcase , towards them .
Then , shovel under one arm and crutch under the other , I hobbled up to the top kennels .
Leif sighed , put down the bowl and hobbled out of the kitchen .
As hard as I tried , I could not make use of the staff , so I carried it , hobbling like a stage imbecile .
Slowly , each movement a vast , unexplored continent of pain , she pushed out from the steps and hobbled past him .
He hobbled through the first available door , which was marked Adjutant General , and saw a red-faced major seated behind the desk .
Nick , who works in a Mars bar factory , hobbled to the altar and sat on a stool for most of the service .
She hobbled to her seat and sat down .
He grabbed the walking stick and hobbled to the side of the pond .
She hobbled to the window and looked down .
` We 're gon na be late , " said Jackie , hobbling towards the door .
